required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of BIBW 2992 (Afatinib) in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Partially Randomised Phase II Study to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of BIBW 2992 in Patients With Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Who Never Received Prior Anti-EGFR (Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor) Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase II study is open to patients with metastatic colorectal cancer who have tried but failed chemotherapy regimens containing oxaliplatin and irinotecan. Patients must not have received anti-EGFR (Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor) treatment (for example, cetuximab, panitumumab) in the past. Patients with wild-type KRAS (v-Ki-ras2 Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog) colorectal cancer will be randomised to receive either BIBW 2992 or cetuximab. Patients with KRAS mutated colorectal cancer will not be randomised, but will all receive BIBW 2992. The main objectives of the study are: to compare the effectiveness of BIBW 2992 with that of cetuximab in patients with KRAS wild type cancer, and to assess the effectiveness of BIBW 2992 in patients with KRAS mutated cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression or death, whichever came first, assessed up to 23 months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response: complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST (version 1.1) without confirmation criteria applied.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Disease Control (DC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression or death, whichever came first, assessed up to 23 months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response or stable disease (SD) as determined by RECIST (version 1.1) with confirmation criteria applied.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression or death, whichever came first, assessed up to 23 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS time is defined as time from randomisation (wild-type group) or start of treatment (mutated group) to tumor progression evaluated according to RECIST (version 1.1) or death whichever occurs earlier. Median and confidence interval estimated using product-limit Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline till death, assessed up to 23 months
secondary_outcome.description: OS time is defined as time from the date of randomisation (wild-type group) or date of start of treatment (mutated group) to the date of death. Median and confidence interval estimated using product-limit Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-dose Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State on Day 8 (Cpre,ss,8)
secondary_outcome.description: Cpre,ss,8 represents the pre-dose concentration of afatinib in plasma at steady state on day 8.

arm_group.description: Patients receive BIBW 2992 tablets once daily
Patients receive cetuximab intravenously once a week, every week

intervention.description: Patients receive BIBW 2992 tablets once daily, and can reduce dose for adverse event management
Patients receive cetuximab intravenously, once a week, every week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients with metastatic colorectal cancer who have failed both oxaliplatin- and irinotecan-based regimens
2. Tumour sample available for KRAS (v-Ki-ras2 Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog) mutation testing and other biomarker analyses.
Exclusion criteria:
1. Prior treatment with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) targeting small molecules or antibodies.
2. Biological treatment (including Bevacizumab or any other antiangiogenic agents) during the trial is not allowed.
3. Known pre-existing interstitial lung disease.
4. Planned major surgical procedures during the trial period.

group.title: Afatinib (Wild-type)
group.description: Afatinib tablets once daily in patients with KRAS (v-Ki-ras2 Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog) wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients started on 40 mg and then increased to 50 mg after 4 weeks if well tolerated.

group.title: Cetuximab (Wild-type)
group.description: Cetuximab 400 mg/m² on Day 1 and then 250mg/m² once a week, every week, intravenous (i.v.) in patients with KRAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer.

group.title: Afatinib (Mutated)
group.description: Afatinib tablets once daily in patients with KRAS mutated metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients started on 40 mg and then increased to 50 mg after 4 weeks if well tolerated.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Refusal to continue taking trial medicat

group.title: Afatinib (Wild-type)
group.description: Afatinib tablets once daily in patients with KRAS (v-Ki-ras2 Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog) wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients started on 40 mg and then increased to 50 mg after 4 weeks if well tolerated.

group.description: Cetuximab 400 mg/m² on Day 1 and then 250mg/m² once a week, every week, intravenous (i.v.) in patients with KRAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response: complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST (version 1.1) without confirmation criteria applied.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression or death, whichever came first, assessed up to 23 months
outcome.population: Randomised set. Primary endpoint for the population of patients with KRAS wildtype tumours.

group.title: Afatinib (Wild-type)
group.description: Afatinib tablets once daily in patients with KRAS (v-Ki-ras2 Kirsten rat sarcoma viral oncogene homolog) wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients started on 40 mg and then increased to 50 mg after 4 weeks if well tolerated.

group.title: Cetuximab (Wild-type)
group.description: Cetuximab 400 mg/m² on Day 1 and then 250mg/m² once a week, every week, intravenous (i.v.) in patients with KRAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Objective Response
measure.description: Percentage of participants with objective response: complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST (version 1.1) without confirmation criteria applied.
measure.population: Randomised set. Primary endpoint for the population of patients with KRAS wildtype tumours.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis is that the objective response rate (ORR) in KRAS wild-type patients treated with afatinib is less than or equal to the ORR in KRAS wild-type patients treated with cetuximab. Sample size is based on a 'pick the winner' approach assuming ORR for cetuximab of 12%, undesirable ORR for afatinib of 11% and desirable ORR for afatinib of 16%. As per 'pick the winner' approach, afatinib would be considered 'the winner' if the ORR for afatinib was greater than the ORR for cetuximab.
analysis.p_value_desc: The statistical analysis is descriptive and exploratory in nature and performed only to provide a statistical framework from which to view the results and plan further studies.
analysis.method_desc: Wald Chi-square test and Confidence Interval from logistic regression stratified by number of lines of palliative chemotherapy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Disease Control (DC)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with objective response or stable disease (SD) as determined by RECIST (version 1.1) with confirmation criteria applied.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression or death, whichever came first, assessed up to 23 months
outcome.population: Treated Set. Primary endpoint for the population of patients with KRAS mutated tumours.

group.title: Afatinib (Mutated)
group.description: Afatinib tablets once daily in patients with KRAS mutated metastatic colorectal cancer. Patients started on 40 mg and then increased to 50 mg after 4 weeks if well tolerated.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Disease Control (DC)
measure.description: Percentage of participants with objective response or stable disease (SD) as determined by RECIST (version 1.1) with confirmation criteria applied.
measure.population: Treated Set. Primary endpoint for the population of patients with KRAS mutated tumours.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis is that the disease control rate is 10% in patients with KRAS mutation. Sample size calculation based on a 2-sided exact binomial test at 10% significance level to distinguish between the historical disease control rate of 10% and a desirable disease control rate for afatinib of 25%.
analysis.p_value_desc: The statistical analysis is descriptive and exploratory in nature and performed only to provide a statistical framework from which to view the results and plan further studies.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS time is defined as time from randomisation (wild-type group) or start of treatment (mutated group) to tumor progression evaluated according to RECIST (version 1.1) or death whichever occurs earlier. Median and confidence interval estimated using product-limit Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression or death, whichever came first, assessed up to 23 months
outcome.population: Randomised set for wild-type group and treated set for mutated group.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
